text: Ma Rainey's Black Bottom is a 2020 American drama movie directed by George C. Wolfe and written by Ruben Santiago-Hudson. It is based on the play of the same name by August Wilson. The movie was produced by Denzel Washington, Todd Black, and Dany Wolf. It stars Viola Davis and Chadwick Boseman, with Glynn Turman, Colman Domingo, and Michael Potts. The movie is about Ma Rainey and talks about her career in Chicago during the 1920s and how her career was affected by racism. It was released on a limited theatrical release on November 25, 2020, before beginning to stream on Netflix on December 18. ==References== Category:2020 drama movies Category:Netflix movies Category:Movies set in Chicago Category:Movies set in the 1920s Category:American drama movies Category:Movies based on plays
